inn1.comm: good length, just outside off stump, Cook defends with an angled bat and gully sweeps up
on the spot again, holding its line outside off stump, and Cook shoulders arms
that's a ripper. Once again it holds its line but this time the line is angled back into the left-hander, and zips inside the bat and over the top of middle. Lovely ball
drawn forward into a big-striding defence, and prodded back down the pitch
on the legs and tucked away calmly for the first run of the day
outside off stump, square-driven but without much power and point fields comfortably
pinged onto a good length with that crazy round-arm action, and defended into the off-side
on the spot again, nudged out to the covers
attempted yorker, Cook clips firmly off the toes, but short midwicket tidies up
wide outside off stump, Cook has a wild slash, but doesn't middle it
driven firmly into the covers off the front foot. Accurate stuff for the most part
lovely first over from Malinga - full length and swinging towards the solitary slip. Cook meets it with a straight bat, and that's a maiden over
clipped off the toes and down to backward square. A bit of a wayward return from Fernando as the ball catches the breeze and sails over the keeper's head

that's the breakthrough and it's a lovely diving catch from the captain, reaching low to his right at slip as Cook fences uncertainly off the back foot. Nothing more than a probing line and length, but Vaas has his reward for eight accurate deliveries
on the spot to the first right-hander in England's line-up. Bell props forward and steers to point
a confident stride from Bell, and Vaas responds by spearing that delivery a little wide of the stumps. A controlled edge to third man brings two
lovely delivery, angling across the right-hander and keeping low. A hint of swing ensures that the bat is beaten
Bell shuffles across his stumps early, and defends off the front foot. He's got dancing feet this morning ...
on the spot after all that excitement, and defended
a hint of width, and slashed down to third man
whistled onto a good length with a powerful surge of the shoulders, and defended again
slightly wider of off stump this time, Bell shapes as if to have a swipe at it, but in the end opts to leave well alone
that's a beautiful stroke. Into position early, head over the ball, and a graceful push through the covers, all the way to the boundary. England's first of the innings
slightly shorter in length, and Bell defends with a loud "no!"
more probing work from Vaas - Mustard comes forward with intent but plays with a straight bat nonetheless
into position early and deflected into the covers for a quick single. Good calling
Bell props forward and pushes into the covers
defended again. Good accuracy from Sri Lanka's openers
two steps down the pitch and a firm drive to mid-off. Almost too well timed as the ball reached the fielder too quickly for a run
dropped! That's a big let-off. Cracking delivery from Vaas, pitching on middle-and-leg, angling across and finding a thick edge straight into Jayawardene's hands ... and out again. A rare blemish
pushed into the covers again. England are being made to struggle at the moment
back of a length, wicket-to-wicket. Defended and a scampered single
a fraction too short and a bit of width, and that whistles through backward point. Lovely timing again
outside off stump again, and Bell attempts a similar stroke, but this time point cuts it off
defended into the covers. A slower ball this time, and Bell spots it late and checks his drive
worked through the gap in the covers, and that just has the legs to reach the rope. Well played again, and a better over for England
short, and Mustard is into position early for a measured pull, but loses his footing a touch as he sets off for a single
Bell is down the track early again, and seeing as he's already halfway to the non-striker's end, he calls for a quick single after a defensive prod
width, but not a lot of bounce. Mustard waits and works this one down to third man to hand the strike over once again. He's not seen much of the ball yet
outside off stump and angling away. Defended out to point

very nice strike indeed. Once again Bell is busy at the crease, stepping across to the off side to work the ball off middle and away through midwicket. Maharoof warms up for his spell with a lengthy chase
big stride forward and met with an angled bat. A huge shout of "no!" as Mustard shimmies for a single to point
good wheels, as they say. Outside off stump and carrying through to the keeper as Bell leaves alone

nailed plumb in front of the stumps, as Bell pays the price for his busy footwork! He shuffled across to work the ball through midwicket, but chose the wrong ball for the shot. He was struck on the kneeroll in front of middle and off, and Rudi Koertzen's slow death finger does the rest
outside off stump, angling away, and left well alone
Pietersen shuffles across the stumps as well, but ends up playing a very measured forward defensive
another huge appeal, but this time Koertzen is not convinced. A very similar delivery, but maybe just sneaking over the stumps
a whippy final delivery of the over, big swing from the hand and Mustard thinks better of chasing it outside off stump
props forward and defends
drawn forward again, picked up in the gully after a slightly airy defensive push
this time he plays from the crease and pushes to cover
good delivery, on off stump and shaping away. Pietersen shoulders arms
full length, outside off, Pietersen meets it with a full face of the bat
a hint of a shuffle at the crease, but Vaas isn't deceived. Right on the spot once again, and that's another maiden
outside off stump, angling across the left-hander. Defended into the covers
on the pads, and nudged behind square for a welcome single. The first for a while ...
on the legs, and tucked straight to midwicket
an uneasy shot from Pietersen, the ball seemed to rear a touch, but he called for two early, and made it easily. Good running
drawn forward and defended again. A slower ball, legcutter, this time
fantastic strike, straight back down the pitch, but too straight. The ball clangs into the base of the non-striker's stumps, and stops dead. Nothing else was going to stop that
he takes a step to leg, and half a step down the pitch before guiding this out into the covers - without timing it
a lovely stroke from Mustard. He really came forward well, driving this fluently and elegantly through the covers. No need to run for those
a little too straight this time and Mustard nudges him to leg for a single
A Pietersen-style slap on the front foot. He tried to work it through midwicket, as is his wont, but smudged it past the bowler for a hastily run single
too short and Mustard pulls this through midwicket, again without really timing it and the sweeper prevents four. And indeed two
and Pietersen clumps this straight to the newly positioned fielder who prevents the single
on his legs, Mustard times this impressively with a flick of the wrists. Jayasuriya is on the boundary, galloping around it like a 20-year-old and he does well to prevent four
full, straight and defended by Pietersen who clamps down on this on the front foot
well bowled. A good off-stump line and a nagging length. Pietersen again comes forward, but can only defend it back to the bowler
that's a beauty from Maharoof. A slower-ball which cuts away from the driving Pietersen
one slower ball too many. Too wide, too short and this time Pietersen's wise to Maharoof's cunning antics
a powerful, orthodox off-drive which goes straight to mid-off
and he starts with an ugly slower ball on off stump. Mustard can't capitalise as well he might, and clumps it straight to point
nearly! A loose stroke from Mustard here, lured into driving at a wide half-volley
dropped out to the off side and Pietersen calls him through for what looks to be a dangerous single. Mustard is quick and the throw is wild and woolly
short of a length this time, Pietersen guides this off the back foot down to a wide third man
an attempted bouncer, but this is a deathly slow pitch and it barely bounces chest high on Mustard who pulls it around the corner
driven, without timing, down the ground
swinging back into the left hander who is cautious in defence
a touch straighter this time, Mustard angles it out into the covers off the back foot
fuller and straighter, Pietersen tries to whip it through leg but the ball finds its way to a short mid-on who, with some wristy flicking, knocks it onto the non-striker's stumps
well bowled again, an excellent slower-ball - completely foxing Pietersen who plays and misses
short of a length, Pietersen is back and across trying to smack this off the back foot, but again without timing
cracked with rare power off the back foot from Pietersen - rare in terms of his knock today, anyway - but once again it finds a fielder, this time at cover point
a wild swing from Mustard at this wider delivery outside off
straighter this time, very well bowled. Mustard defends
Mustard steps outside leg but the bowler sees him coming, firing the ball into his pads. Mustard gets his bat in the way and it zoots out to the covers
very full, Pietersen hammers it into the ground and it flies over the bowler's head for a single
a neat stroke, late cut down to third man. No power, though...
he holds this one back a touch and Pietersen strokes it into the off side
it's a four! A boundary for England, their fifth, as Mustard smudges this through midwicket
he attempts the same shot but can't time it this time
swinging into Pietersen who is rapped on the pads but it's going down leg. Mustard wants a single and is miles down the pitch...and he's a goner, if the fielder hits the stumps. Which he doesn't
pushed out into the covers
forward on the front foot, he works this through midwicket for a zero
squidged out to the covers
nice and straight, Pietersen nudges it just past the bowler and he scampers off for a hectic single
swinging into the left-hander who times it out to cover. Good running yields a single
nudged to cover, Mustard wants a run but is forced to dive back into his ground
a slow bouncer which KP pulls for a single
Mustard steps outside leg and squeezes it out to point...but he can't find the gap
full and fast, clumped to mid-on for a massive single
poor stroke. Mustard steps to the off side and tries to scoop this slower ball over fine leg, but gets a top edge which is safely snaffled in the covers
and here's Pietersen with a thumping cover drive for four. At last some authority from Pietersen
swinging into Pietersen who pushes it out to cover
Pietersen dances down the pitch like a blind ballerina, but is foxed by a slower ball as he tries to hit him over the top
cover-driven for a zero, Pietersen getting an inside edge
defended out to cover
full, straight and it's nudged with style to midwicket
short of a length, Pietersen tries to pull this but can only hammer it into the pitch
banged in short of a length, it climbs onto Pietersen who pulls this from outside the off stump straight to Jayawardene at midwicket
flicked off his pads down to fine leg. Shah has to dive, though - but he's quick, and the dive is a good one
"no run," says Shah, defending this on the front foot
short of a length, Shah ignores it
solidly defended on the front foot by Collingwood
excellent delivery! Very well bowled, swinging this into Collingwood who is beaten all ends up, the ball passing his inside edge
too straight but a good enough length, Collingwood unable to make anything of it, just nudging it to leg
orthodoxly driven out to mid-off for another massive zero
pushed out to cover
defended on the front foot
low full toss on the shins, driven into the covers
low again, defended on the front foot
right up there, defended on the front foot
good delivery, turning away from the batsman and nearly taking the snick as he failed to deal with it
defended on the back foot
defended on the front foot to round off another Test-match-ish over
up there, outside off, tries to flay a drive and again mistimes it
slower delivery and defended well, pushing forward for a quick single
on middle-and-leg, turned well off the legs behind square and England push hard for the run
up there, slightly zippier than expected, and the batsman chops down on it, hardly getting any bat there and the bark of "No" (not from one of the dogs, mind) is an obvious one
a legcutter beats Sha who gets an outside edge chopping down into the pitch
deliberately cut fine through the vacant slips cordon and the pressure is temporarily eased with that ball
up there, on off, driven back out to mid-off
another slower delivery, played forward on the front foot
on off, turned to midwicket for an easy single
driven forward for a quick single
Collingwood goes for the cover drive but checeks the shot and it flies uppish - but safe
worked to midwicket
on off and turned in front of midwicket for a comfortable single
makes room to turn to midwicket for another easy single
outside off, cut behind point
on off-and-middle, and eased into the leg-side off the knees
down leg and Collingwood pops one up - a leading edge - not getting over the ball off the back foot - and again he finds space
across the right hander with enough width - a shade - for Shah to come forward and play an attacking drive past cover
on off, and defended
Malinga pinpoint accurate again, Shah content to defend on the front foot, though
just outside off, Malinga building the pressure here, worked into the covers
bouncer crashes over off, Collingwood turns away from hit and dips his shoulder at the last milisecond
more of the short stuff, on a leg line this time, Collingwood could have perhaps snuck that one past the keeper with a fine flick off the hips... but he didn't
short again, but fuller than the last one, and on off - it's turned away off the hips, tucked if you like, in front of square
tucks him up, Collingwood forced on to his back foot to defend
tries to turn it off his thigh now
outside off, generates some turn back into the right hander
a prod forward
straight delivery, bowling wicket to wicket, and defended quietly enough
Shah shows the desire to drive through mid-off but hasn't timed it properly
and this time he doesn't have the room to manoeuvre into midwicket as he would have liked, almost stopping on the shot
outside off, room enough to drive to the covers
very full delivery on leg, worked off the toes - with a last-gasp stab - towards leg
outside off, driven through the covers
short and pulled away behind square - reached out and controlled it right down
right up there, just outside off now, and the batsman can't really work it away
swing as the ball whirls in low towards leg, and zooms right on
outside off, Collingwood shouts "No" almost before he's poked a defensive forward
reaches outside off to sweep low - much like a hockey sweep in fact - which nutmegs Sangakkara. It's a multisport fest out there that ball
a dot this time
shuffles the ball through and it pitches outside off, keeps low, and turns into the right hander who deals with it defensively
a tight one again, worked towards the covers, without a sniff of a run
touch of room on leg now, and worked into short midwicket
down the track, Shah would really have loved to crack that one through mid-off, instead his galloping ends with a tame check
driven into the covers
starts from wide of the crease and lobs in from outside off, the ball worked back out to the covers
worked into the covers again
pushed him onto the back foot and they take another single with a steer towards the covers
Shah comes out of his crease before Jayasuriya's even delivered with another hockey-ish swat from outside off to midwicket
worked into the covers again. England will be pleased with that over
worked off the hips in front of square
rushed to square again
driven out to mid-on for an easy single
on middle, played off the front foot out to mid-on
driven out to mid-on again
drags that one down leg, and it's helped on its way with a swish
on the spot and defended with a tangle of limbs
drawn forward and pushed out to the covers
quick feet, but little reward as midwicket fields
low full-toss, but Collingwood can't cash in
down the track and clobbered, but without any timing
worked into the leg-side, but no way through the ring. A very tidy over
a couple of measured steps down the track, and a firm clip into the gap at midwicket
driven, into the covers, no way through. Repeat ad nauseam
nurdled once again, tick off those singles
flicked off the pads
a bonus there, three neat runs courtesy of some good timing off the pads
driven into the deep
driven hard, but straight to short cover
up and under from Collingwood - he was aiming into the leg-side, but found no-man's land in the covers instead
good use of the feet, and Collingwood picks off a welcome boundary with a trademark shovel over midwicket
defended into the covers
neatly done, steered off an open face, into the gap at third man. Useful runs in that over
on the pads and tweaking further down the leg-side, worked off the hips to backward square
a fraction short of a length, but worked without any venom to midwicket
driven hard, and half-stopped by the bowler who scurries out to midwicket to field
flicked into the leg-side and an instant call. Collingwood easily beats the shy from midwicket
defended out to the leg-side
more flight - Shah thought about having a swipe, but decided for caution instead
full length, there to be driven and Collingwood obliged. But Fernando stoops to field in his followthrough
good length again, defended back down the pitch
outside off stump, Collingwood is into position for the drive, but can't find the gap
short, and swung away in an instant! That livened up the proceedings a touch. Clears the midwicket rope, and that's England's second six of the series ...
short again and another cross-batted heave. Less effective this time, as deep square tidies up on the boundary's edge
an effort delivery - Fernando grunts in his followthrough - but misdirected
full, straight, and gone! Collingwood was aiming leg-side having shuffled across his stumps, but the ball kept low and beat him for pace. A big, big breakthrough. The skipper is sunk
floated onto middle-and-leg, and worked away off the pads
pushed out to the covers
into position for a pre-meditated sweep, and tickles the ball over his shoulder to backward square
fancy footwork, and a whipped single to midwicket
A soft dismissal, and a big one too. Bopara steps way across his stumps in an attempt to work one off his pads, but he misses it entirely and loses his leg stump! Now England really are in trouble
Swann glides one off his pads, and scampers back for two
in the slot for the slash, but square-driven straight to point
busy at the crease again, and cut behind square
full and straight, defended staunchly into the covers
attempted yorker, well dug out
banged in and pulled away, reasonably effectively
another short ball, but it's that cunning slower bouncer. Shah shapes to pull, but has to settle for a nurdled single
a big stride down the pitch, and a nurdle off the hips
smacked into the deep on the off-side. England content to deal in singles. They are going nowhere fast
turned to midwicket. No way through there
another scamper to rotate the strike
a change of pace, and worked off the hips to fine leg
faster and flatter, speared in towards leg stump, and cracked down to mid-off
full and straight, a hint of late movement but Swann is equal to it as he drives down the ground
slightly misdirected, but worked off the pads effectively to put backward square to work
floated up outside off stump, and a tidy checked drive brings two more to deep cover
low full-toss, smacked out to mid-off
straight, and slightly shorter. Defended either way
at last, a hint of aggression, but it doesn't come off. And another over dribbles by for England
another jogged single
on a good length, and met with an arrow-straight bat
flicked to midwicket, one run almost becomes two as the shy comes in, but a loud "no!" ends that thought
turned off middle-and-leg
another single, to somewhere
tucked off the back foot to midwicket. Yet another single.
and he tries to late cut and misses
another late cut which whacks into the wicketkeeper's gloves, but he didn't really stand a chance of taking that and the ball ricochets to short third man
full, straight and defended
a paddle sweep by Shah who scoops it down to fine-leg. Lasith Malinga and his massive hair prevent four
swings across the line and misses, the ball rapping him high on the pad. Vaas roars a painful-sounding appeal but he was outside the line
timed off the back foot to deep extra cover...for a single
on middle-and-leg, Swann pats it back to Dilshan
short, wide and cut like a winner
cut late to Mubarak at backward point who slips, lands awkwardly on his derriÃ¨re but gets a hand to it
rubbish. Down the leg side and left alone
whipped through midwicket
defended out to cover
turned off his hip for a single
a magnificent ball, spearing into Shah who plays it quite brilliantly, digging it out and squirting the ball to point. Superb fielding prevents the single
intelligent bowling here from Lasith, pitching it up - hoping for swing - and Shah plays a top-class drive to mid-off for a zero
elegantly, superbly late-cut to bring up a memorable fifty - his fourth in one-dayers
top shot. A short-arm punch, biffed over mid-off for a magical boundary
whipped through midwicket with style, if not placement
marvellous bowling, that, pitching it up outside the off stump. Swann feathers it to third man
sharp turn for Dilshan. Swann pats it out to cover
excellent use of his feet from Shah, skipping down the pitch and smiting it down the ground for four. Fernando makes a pig's ear at long-on
turned off his toes
down the leg side
short, wide and cut out to cover
smartly nudged to leg for a single, and there ends Dilshan's 10-over spell. Well done that man
slapped on the front foot over the infield, over mid-off, but without any timing or power...but he's got just enough on it to evade the fielder
down the leg side and rightly wided
pushed out to cover
Swann steps to leg before beaking this to point
a slower ball, and a good one too which Swann tries to cut but can't quite time it. Shah implores him not to run
down the pitch from Swann who tries to smite Lasith through the covers, but fails
clipped off his legs and they come back for two to give Shah the strike in the next over
guided off the back foot to extra cover for a single
quicker ball drifting down the leg side which Swann lifts over short midwicket for a single
he steps outside the leg stump but Lasith sees him and spears the ball into his legs. An ugly across-the-line smear yields but a single
cut out to cover
swinging into his legs, Swann clobbers it down the ground
short enough for Swann to cut it out into the deep
a swing and a miss outside the off stump
a Dominic Cork-style crunch on the front foot just evading mid-off. Neat stroke, and a fumble from Maharoof
short, Swann tennis-swats it out to the off side
swinging into his legs, he clumps it to nowhere
a one-handed smite over midwicket for three. Excellent fielding on the boundary, too
well bowled! A slower ball, completely foxing Shah who smiles and nods at the bowler's artfulness
smeared down the ground for another single
cuts it out to deep extra cover, and they take two. But no! They're coming back for three, but the throw is hard and fast and it's curtain's for Swann who is metres short of his ground
Shah chops this down to the off side
excellent shot - very well played indeed by Shah. Outside the off stump, Shah whips it fine - very fine - down to fine-leg for four. Top shot
neatly turned off his toes for a single
Broad tries to hammer this off the back foot but cuts it into the ground, the ball bobbles out meekly
what a shot! Shah literally took that millimetres from his leg stump and nicked it to fine-leg for another four. Clever, skilful batting and this is turning into a very impressive innings
pulled through midwicket with a heavy bottom hand
pumped out to cover, and he calls Broad through (belatedly) for a single. Had the throw not hit the dancing umpire, he'd have been toast
full and straight, driven down the ground for a single. Good timing from Broad
that's well timed from Shah this time - perhaps too well, as it zoots to mid-off and they can only grab a single
Broad gets a thick inside edge down to fine leg
well bowled. A slower ball to begin with, an off cutter which Broad misreads
smudged out to cover
full toss which Broad carves out to deep extra. Shah denies him two to retain the strike
what a catch that is. Cracked on the front foot by Shah, aerially, and Chamara Silva dived high to his left at a wide mid-off to cling on. A superb take to end a very fine innings
crunched on the front foot, and they take the single. In comes the throw, and there's a strangled appeal but he's safely home
an ugly, hopeful heave over the bowler's head. Long-on can't quite get there, diving full length, and they pick up three

inn2.comm: stays over, zooms in from outside off, across the left hander, driven into the covers
short one already - ducked easily
outside off, worked into the covers
on leg, tucked off the hips to deep square where Broad does well to hunt it down in a few strides and a long stretch
very full, but driven into the covers
turned down to Sidebottom who returns with casual ease
the first boundary of the innings - through square leg
England strike early! Just outside off, a thick edge and Cook takes a tumbling catch to his left at second slip
from wicket to wide in one easy step
got him, dropped him, as Will has just helpfully noted, almost a mirror of the second ball this over, but Cook this time can't cling on as the batsman fends on the back foot
squares up again and the thick edge skews out through point
tight delivery, squeezing Sangakkara into tucking down the ball off his hips
Banshee-like appeal for one which zips through down off, curling away like a Dali 'tache and clips his pad - but it hadn't done enough
outside off, poked forward
slips through outside off
stays over, wangs that down outside off and it's tidily down off the back foot
played off the back foot in front of point where Bell does well to run in with attacking intent and wang it in back to the keeper
turned off the hips to square

dropped. Another chance goes begging - tough not mind, but all the same... a thick edge from what would have been an upper cut and a leaping Mustard can only claw at it as the ball cannons off his palm
straight delivery, straight bat, straight defence. Straightforward, really
defended backward this time, towards point in the end
stays over ... so it's left-armer to left hander, but not left - a straight delivery forcing a back-foot defence
brisk down the channel, Jayasuriya's eyes widen as he thinks about cutting hard but pulls out of the shot at the last
on off, cutting in towards Jayasuriya who waits until the ball's right on to his bat before pressing into the leg-side, in front of square
defended forward and Sidebottom becomes aggressive in picking up the ball and mockshying towards Mustard
loads of width, and square-drives on the up in front of point
tighter, but still enough room to fence towards point this time. No run
driven off the back foot through extra cover
lets that one through - well, they've got enough for the over, non?
...apparently not, full flay off a wide one behind point. Anderson will be grateful to his fielders there, two excellent dives
touch of room outside off, driven off the back foot through the covers
stole that single there, a poke into the covers and they were even looking for two from the overthrow which was a tad wild
on middle-and-leg, England like it but the umpire doesn't and the ball drifts down leg
outside off, driven off the back foot in front of point
width outside off and Jayasuriya lashes a punch off the back foot to cover where Bell holds on to a stinger
across the right hander who stands firm and sturdies a defence down off the back foot
straight and barn-doored back down
across the left hander, defended on the back foot
across him again, straightening on off and a good length, defended off the back foot
more nip, and a bit of tuck, across the left hander who shoulders arms
on a good length, teasing Sangakkara, or trying to - the batsman comes forward and shows him his chest
across the left hander, driven off the back foot into the covers
on off, pinged off the back foot in front of square
on off, rising, defended consequently off the back foot down into the covers
on off again, pinpointed, defended back down
outside off, climbing a touch, jumps back and defends well down
pushed up there, defended on the back foot but dancing forward at the same time, unusually enough
outside off, easing away with a gentle arc, and prodded into the covers without trouble
outside off, not as much curve, defended off the back foot
on off, angling in, Jayawardene waits and has all the time to defend forward
angling in again, towards middle this time, helped on the way off the toes
outside off, plenty of width, driven out to cover
nibbled across the left hander, heading on the up towards off, and defended easily
outside off, a lifter which nearly gets the man - Sangakkara slashing hard at a late cut - but luckily for him it was too late
outside off, worked into the off side by our colleague Sangakkara
on leg, and Sidebottom, not impressed with his width, growls as the turn off the hips results in a single behind square
firmly up there, and a drive into the ground prompts Pietersen into fielding action
outside off, pushed down the channel and it carries through
on middle, swished with a late dink into midwicket and some casual fielding allows a second
outside off, defended off the back foot straight back down the track
down leg, turned well through fine
angled down to third man, ambled single, trundled return
back and across, into line, studious defence
again turned a bit square on, met with the full face and patted firmly to mid-on
back but a little cramped as the ball jags back into him, all he can do it jerk the ball into the leg side
more width, crisply driven into the covers, Bopara at cover leaps to his left and gathers the ball at full length while a foot off the ground
sweetly clipped off his toes square on the leg side, Broad races round from long leg, picks up one handed and that's enough to deter a third which was probably there had they been a few years younger
pushed very boringly into the off side, soporifically fielded and tossed back to the bowler
a little extra bounce and the ball spits past a probing outside edge
very watchful, pushed to extra cover
he pulled down on that as he let go and it was heading down the leg side from the second it left his hand
pushed firmly to the right of mid-on, a loud shout of "yes" and both batsmen stay rooted to the spot
good length, Jayawardene back and across, pushed defensively into the off side
slower ball, Jayawardene picks it but by the time he has he can only push half-heartedly square on the off side
bowled from wide on the crease, angling into the left hander and the ball is turned into the hands of square leg
drop and run a few feet into the off side, a quick call and the batsman beats the diving underarm throw of point
slanted down the leg side, it strikes the pads as Jayawardene swishes to leg and bobbles into the on side
shorter, steps back and cuts to point
cut harder and slightly finer so it evades point, Sidebottom hurtles round the rope and fields superbly on the slide
wide, Sangakkara flashes, gets a thick edge and Mustard takes a good, low catch diving to his left.
back of a length from Sidebottom, back of the crease from Jayawardene, blocked
again Jayawardene forced back and he can do no more than block
slanted across the right hander, a bit of a limp prod and Mustard takes the ball which was inches from the edge
patted into the off side
again no more than a defensive shot and the England cordon again strangles the ball and prevents the run
on the same spot, Jayawardene back and blocks to cover
a first baller for Silva, undone by a bit more bounce, he can't get over the ball, it takes the shoulder of the bat and loops gently to backward point
a loud appeal - entirely without hope as the ball was heading well down the leg side, but on a hat-trick you've got to try
pushed into the off side
short but too wide, Dilshan steps back and hammers that high over backward point and it races over the rope
back, pushed wide of midwicket and that allows a well-run single
played with an angled bat and soft hands to the right of point
flicked off his hips into the leg side, there's a man there on the one for just that shot
swished but not timed between square leg and midwicket
circumspect and solid forward defensive
a trifle leggish, a big swing, it takes a deflection off the pad, too thick for Mustard to have a chance of cutting it off, too thin to take it into the reach of long leg
firm push-drive between cover and extra cover
back, he shapes to whip it through midwicket but his timing is all over the place and the ball splutters a few yards into the leg side
defensive push down the pitch, the bat twists in his hands as he plays it and the ball dribbles back to Broad
slower ball, looping outside of stump, driven to Collingwood at extra cover
forced back, again defended back to Broad
best shot of the innings, wide and just short of a length, he waits, leans slightly back and cracks the ball all along the ground through the covers

attempts a tip and run, gets a thick edge into his front pad which was on the move, and that gives the ball an extra boost and so it goes quicker to the incoming fielder than it might otherwise have .... in other words, no run
cut to point, not placed wide of the fielder
a bit of a loosener outside off, no shot attempted
slower ball, Dilshan was looking to hit that high over the bowler's head but was undone by the change of pace and he misses
Dilshan gets in a complete muddle, all tangled up, the ball hits him but was heading down the leg
worked round the corner on the leg side
driven on the up through the covers, the man patrolling the boundary trots in and fields

short, pulled high towards square leg, for a moment it appeared as if he had got under it and it was going more up than out, but it had the legs and was a one-bounce four and square enough to be out of harm's way as well
tipped a yard or two into the on side for a scurried single
whipped off his legs behind square on the leg side, superb running allows the second
defensive pat into the off
short and pulled with a flourish and a swivel, all along the ground. Maximum effort for scant reward ...
short and wide, poked off the face to short third man where Shah deftly fields
he looks to squirt the ball to leg, it takes a thick edge and dribbles into the off side
slightly short, whipped off his hips to deep midwicket
indiscriminate dab outside off stump which he misses
cut off the back foot, he did well there as he was cramped for room but he still timed the ball
down the leg side, a thin deflection off the pads and Mustard makes a good diving half-stop
deflected into the leg side
short, pulled well with a good roll of the wrists
short ball and there's a lucky shot - a huge hoick of a hook takes a big edge and flies up, up and way over Mustard
angling in at the right hander who shimmies the ball off his hips behind square
plenty of room outside off and cut off the back foot through point
cut away behind point
still outside off, but tighter, a dab towards point, a quick single and a run in from point ending in an underarm throw
outside off, cut late and fine through third man - well watched
outside off, cut to point where Shah tidies up well and throws back in from his knees
dobbled on to the spot, driven back into the pitch
"Catch it" jokes Mustard as the ball is sent wide, correspondingly drilled through the covers and they come back for two
driven off the back foot to point
poked into the ground
strays down leg and helped off the toes behind square
driven forward for a quick single
plenty of turn from outside off, cramping him for room, defended forward
excellent delivery, turning back in and getting the batsman to drive - the ball crashing through the gate and onto the sticks
defended first time
and defended second time, stoutly
on leg, turned to midwicket where it's tightly stopped and quickly thrown back
on off, tight, rising, squeezed into the off side
the ball starts wideish, and some movement away carries it wider. The batsman goes chasing with an icecream scoop of a drive
defended forward
more away swing, driven forward
outside off, swing away, a cover drive towards Bell - tantalisingly, some may say
stopped on him, he tried to turn it onto the leg-side and sends a leading edge to Pietersen who takes a very tidy catch indeed
outside off and turns away from the left hander
turn again, but well away from the left hander
outside off, defended on the front foot
turned off the shins towards midwicket
outside off, reaches out to drive to the covers
on off, defended forward
nipped in from outside off, turned off the ankles in front of square
on leg, turned through midwicket and Sidebottom hunts it down inside the boundary
outside off, turned away - and left alone
short, steepling through off, left again
short, on middle, and hooked round
tries a swipe, doesn't connect
outside off and however urgent the "Catch it" is - which is pretty urgent - there is no wicket as it hardly pops up
same again, and same again (or (Beth) ditto if you like)
turned to short midwicket
up there and defended on the back foot
swiped away on the back foot to deep midwicket
swiddles up from leg into space and on, harmlessly, towards fine leg
across the left hander, drive to cover, left alone
crashed in on middle, defended on the front foot
up there and a forward defence
enough width outside off to cut behind point but an over-eager return results in an overthrow to bring up the hundred
outside off, defended off the back foot into the covers
a tidy delivery. Good line? Tick. Good length? Tick. Forward defence? Spot on
outside off and reached out to sweep - as cheekily as a sweep can be, which is very - round through the 45
full delivery, tight, and the most obvious thing to do is to defend forward. So he does
pitches on middle then curves naughtily away from the batsman who watches it before poking forward
a quick second run is just-to-say well taken: a half-hearted referral to the third umpire takes no time to clear up, but a direct hit would have been very close indeed
defended forward
confident, well-swept sweep
banged down and across the left hander's shoulder, who pulls out of that one on the swivel
short again, straight this time and a duck is called into play
angled flatter across this time, a forthright drive finds cover
slight swing in from outside off, driven back out to cover
outside off, short and pulled way away through midwicket for a clean four
outside off and back-to-back fours as a late cut is well turned through third man
outside off, turns back into the right hander who muffles it with a soft bat
a quicker one, a sweep, a big appeal, but the umpire is moved only to shake his head
"Cachercacher" suggests Mustard mysteriously, as the ball is pressed down forward
again a quiet delivery, dealt with defensively
driven back forward, evidence of attacking intent with a flurry of the back foot
steps forward to press the ball behind square this time - off the pads, says the ump, and so shall the scorebook
outside off, width, comes back in, and is well worked off the back foot in front of point
straight delivery, defended forward - a loud appeal from the fielders but tellingly not from Collingwood
across the left hander, who chooses to leave
across him again, tighter, but still makes enough room to pull in front of square
width outside off and he dangles his bat away from his body to guide it easily to the covers, setting off immediately
outside off and waits for the drive into the covers
down leg, turned on its way
outside off, driven back to the bowler, and there's an excellent catch, snapped low
on a length, on middle, and driven into the ground
on off, slightly short, played off the back foot behind point
outside off, turned away, poked down to gully
up there, driven into the covers
comes out, drives back to the covers
past the outside edge, slinking away, has a poke at it
moving away from him again, and an outside edge from a drive bounces just in front of Shah
big shout for leg-before, turned off the legs
angling across the left hander, swinging away, found the outside edge as he chased it. Mustard made no mistake
a tame dot
on off, worked forward
low full toss, worked into the short midwicket region
run out at the non-striker's end without scoring, courtesy of Bell's quick work from cover
defended on the front foot
turned down leg by the bowler, then the batsman and Cook gives chase
right up there, defended on the front foot
right up there, full and nearly a bunger, driven back out to mid-on
short delivery flies up and past the grille
outside off, dragged a touch short but driven into the covers where Cook lobs a gentle throw back in - as a lady, I'm not allowing myself to describe that as a girl's throw
outside off again, slower delivery, deceived the batsman who offers a lame scoop
driven hard into the ground and out towards cover - some game oomph in that shot
short, and swiped round off the back foot to square
on leg, and turned down behind square
bit of air to that, turned round through the 45
a quick single - but Sri Lanka will need more than that right now
another one
a forward defence this time
scrambled single to point
starts with a straight one, as he likes, right up there
driven into the covers
outside off, cut away behind deep point for a quick single, Anderson doing the work out there
outside off, a touch short, an unconventional - OK, ugly - flat-bat back towards the covers. Doesn't time it
big edge from a low full toss bounces down in front of first slip
angles in awkwardly, defended on the front foot
swilled in straight, and defended on the front foot
outside off, pressed forward, and thoughts of a single are soon banished to the don't-think-so cupboard
driven on the up and up and eventually collected by Broad inside the extra cover boundary
outside off, turns in, eased down to backward point
on middle and off, worked in front of midwicket
a massive appeal for a fairly straight one that hits the leg just outside the line - Swann can't believe it
up there, driven to mid-off
outside off, late cut down to a wideish third man
defended on the front foot
outside off, moving away with some width, bunted over the top of cover off the base of the bat
pushed across the right hander who swipes at it
low full toss driven on the up out towards the sweeper on the off-side boundary
on the front foot
eased down off the back foot
on leg, turned to short midwicket
defended sturdily on the front foot
extra flight, straight and a great shot, driven over the covers, hitting with the spin
on leg, pressed round to Pietersen who returns on one knee
short and hooked through the 45 - that was very firmly struck indeed
worked off the back foot to third man
outside off, poked away from the body
outside off, cut away off the back foot
worked into the covers
dragged only slightly short but well hooked through midwicket
played off the hips to short square and a quick single
short, outside off, tried to hook it away but completely missed it
up there on leg, driven out to long-off
cut down off the back foot
short, on off, and defended on the back foot
outside off and flashes away from his body - strike one
full delivery, driven out through the covers
planted on a relatively good length, eased into the covers
worked on the up on leg wide of Sidebottom racing round
worked forward, some pressure starting to build now
away from the body - a poke again, but just fails to connect and breathes again
cutter again, slower delivery, defended on the back foot
not the prettiest shot - a hoick from outside off connects with nothing
a more professional manoeuvre this time - even if it was a leave to a short one
short one, straight and there's a call to the third umpire for a run-out for Collingwood's bullet from backward point and that completes the win
